snippet: The rise of the Socialist François Hollande, who is slightly favored to win the French presidency on Sunday, is still a surprise to many in the country.
abstract: Rise of the French Socialist Party candidate Francois Hollande, who is slightly favored to win France's presidential election, is still a surprise to many in the country who see him as a hardworking and convivial but second-rank politician.
lead_paragraph: The rise of the Socialist François Hollande, who is slightly favored to win the French presidency on Sunday, is still a surprise to many in the country.

headline.seo: In Race to French Presidency, Hollande Sets His Own Pace
headline.main: In French Race, the Tortoise Sets His Own Pace
headline.print_headline: In Race to French Presidency, the Tortoise Sets His Own Pace
